channel.title: ClassHandler
channel.description:
Is having all these "handlers" in servers really necessary? Example: DialogueHandler, NPCHandler, PlayerHandler, etc.
If so why are they necessary to have?

item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

actually they are useless, way back when everyone would make fun of other client.java due to the size of the class. so people started thinking that if you make a bunch of static classes called “handlers” it was a easy fix for the problem.

item.title: ClassHandler
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

More or less just bad naming for the classes back then. NPCHandler and PlayerHandle are for the most part the classes that hold all the variables and methods for updating, attacking, register and deregister from the local and global lists, ect, ect. When in fact you could just use NPC and Player as the names, I know on WinterLove bases servers you have both classes with each of them having a few hundred variables that could be combined into a abstract class that both can extend just so you don’t have so many of the same variables.
